webp

Class WebpHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • webp.WebpHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageHandler

    public class WebpHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImageHandler
    Handles the processing and collection of chunks, including EXIF metadata chunk, from a WEBP image file.
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebpHandler

        public WebpHandler(java.nio.file.Path fpath,
                   SequentialByteReader reader,
                   java.util.EnumSet<WebPChunkType> requiredChunks)
        Constructs a handler to parse selected chunks from a WebP image file.
        Parameters:
        fpath - the path to the WebP file for logging purposes
        reader - byte reader for raw WebP stream
        requiredChunks - an optional set of chunk types to be extracted (null means all chunks are selected)

    • Method Detail

      • getChunks

        public java.util.List<WebpChunk> getChunks()
        Retrieves a list of chunks that have been extracted.
        Returns:
        an unmodified list of chunks

      • existsChunk

        public boolean existsChunk(WebPChunkType type)
        Checks if a chunk with the specified type has already been set.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the chunk
        Returns:
        true if the chunk is already present

      • getExifData

        public java.util.Optional<byte[]> getExifData()
        Retrieves the embedded EXIF data from the WebP file, if present.

        The EXIF metadata is stored in the EXIF chunk as raw TIFF-formatted data. If the WebP file contains an EXIF chunk, its byte array is returned wrapped in Optional. If no EXIF chunk exists, Optional.empty() is returned.

        Returns:
        an Optional containing the EXIF data as a byte array if found, or Optional.empty() if absent

      • getSafeFileSize

        public long getSafeFileSize()
        Returns the length of the image file associated with the current InputStream resource.
        Specified by:
        getSafeFileSize in interface ImageHandler
        Returns:
        the length of the file in bytes, or 0 if the size cannot be determined

      • parseMetadata

        public boolean parseMetadata()
                      throws ImageReadErrorException
        Begins metadata processing by parsing the WebP file and extracting chunk data.
        Specified by:
        parseMetadata in interface ImageHandler
        Returns:
        true if at least one chunk element was successfully extracted, or false if no relevant data was processed
        Throws:
        ImageReadErrorException - if an error occurs while parsing the file

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a textual representation of all parsed WebP chunks in this file.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        formatted string of all parsed chunk entries

      • readFileHeader

        private int readFileHeader(SequentialByteReader reader)
        Read the file header of the given WebP file. Basically, it checks for correct RIFF and WEBP signature entries within the first few stream bytes. It also determines the full size of this file.
        Parameters:
        reader - byte reader for raw WebP stream
        Returns:
        the size of the WebP file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the WebP header information is corrupted

      • parseChunks

        private void parseChunks(int riffFileSize)
                  throws ImageReadErrorException
        Processes the WebP data stream and extracts matching chunk types into memory.
        Parameters:
        riffFileSize - the size of the WebP file, including the RIFF header
        Throws:
        ImageReadErrorException - if invalid structure or erroneous chunks are detected

      • addChunk

        private void addChunk(WebPChunkType type,
                      int fourCC,
                      int length,
                      byte[] data)
        Adds a parsed chunk to the internal chunk collection.
        Parameters:
        type - the WebP chunk type in enum constant
        fourCC - the 32-bit FourCC chunk identifier (in little-endian integer form)
        length - the length of the chunk's payload
        data - raw chunk data
